processhandle.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #! /usr/bin/env python
2 import signal, psutil, subprocess
3 
4 class ProcessHandler:
5 
6  def __init__(self, command, cwdopt="./"):
7  self.p = psutil.Popen(command, stdin=subprocess.PIPE, shell=True, cwd=cwdopt)
8 
9  def is_active(self):
10  self.p.poll()
11  ret = True if (self.p.returncode == None) else False
12  return ret
13 
14  def kill_proc_tree(self):
15  # Get all children recursively
16  children = self.p.get_children(recursive=True)
17 
18  # Try to SIGINT first
19  for child in children:
20  child.send_signal(signal.SIGINT)
21  gone, alive = psutil.wait_procs(children, timeout=2)
22 
23  # Try to SIGTERM those that are alive
24  for child in alive:
25  child.terminate()
26  gone, alive = psutil.wait_procs(children, timeout=1)
27 
28  # Finally brute force kill those alive
29  for child in alive:
30  child.kill()
31 
32  def __del__(self):
33  self.kill_proc_tree()
34 
35  # Older version, keeping here but deprecated
36  '''
37  # Full credit to http://stackoverflow.com/questions/392022/best-way-to-kill-all-child-processes/8544913#8544913
38  # Modified to send SIGINT signal to kill processes
39  pid = self.p.pid
40  subprocess.Popen("kill -INT `pstree -p %d | grep -oP '(?<=\()[0-9]+(?=\))'`" % pid, shell=True)
41 
42  # Kill processes that did not exit on SIGINT
43  #TODO: find if there are any processes left before trying this
44  time.sleep(1)
45  subprocess.Popen("kill `pstree -p %d | grep -oP '(?<=\()[0-9]+(?=\))'`" % pid, shell=True)
46  '''
47 
48  # Oldest version, keeping here but deprecated
49  '''
50  ps_command = subprocess.Popen("ps -o pid --ppid %d --noheaders" % self.p.pid, shell=True, stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
51  ps_output = ps_command.stdout.read()
52  retcode = ps_command.wait()
53  assert retcode == 0, "ps command returned %d" % retcode
54  for pid_str in ps_output.split("\n")[:-1]:
55  os.kill(int(pid_str), signal.SIGINT)
56  time.sleep(1)
57  self.p.kill()
58  self.p.terminate()
59  '''
60
